Reviews.Title: “Not very nice, even at the low price”
Reviews.Author: Marty98
Reviews.Content: Most staff could do with customer service training. The hotel itself has a shabby and dated feel and in some places the decor is shockingly bad. There is a tube map in the foyer which is at least 40 years old as it does not even include the Victoria Line! I assume this is the last time the hotel itself was refurbished. My room was clean but it was also stiflingly hot all the time as the radiator appeared to be stuck on max. The only way to cool things down was to open the window, to the roar of Euston Road. The TV had no remote control and the bed was uncomfortable and at least 30 years old. The doors to each hotel room are flimsy, the locks are totally inadequate, the doors and walls do not keep out any noise. Guests coming and going and also housekeeping woke me up several times, unless you put the do not disturb sign up, cleaning staff enter you room at 8am or earlier. Breakfast was a basic english menu, the coffee was horrible but the bacon and eggs were OK, the breakfast staff seemed to stand around staring, which wasn't exactly nice, there were also too many of them, and I felt as though I was being watched. All in all a pretty horrible hotel, even at the low price, its only plus point being its central location.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jkskhdkuasyd
Reviews.Content: Please, do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else. I can't say enough how much staying here was an upsetting experience. This is THE WORST AND MOST DEPRESSING place I have ever had the misfortune of staying at. I was not comfortable going to the bathroom at night to the the shared facilities where questionable looking characters sometimes lurked in hallways. You could hear everything in other rooms and doors were slamming all night long. I gave up showering and took to bird baths in the room after unsightly dark hair clumps in the shared showers remained for a few days and I realised the showers must not get cleaned. Toilets were often not flushed and often broken...yes...it was as disgusting as it sounds. It is in a terrible neighbourhood also with no restaurants nearby that are worth going to. You will have to travel out of the area to do anything. There are moths/little bugs everywhere which get in your clothes. The staff were terrible, unfriendly and unhelpful. The "breakfast" was pathetic and the staff in the dining area rude and again, unfriendly and unwelcoming. There are much better places to stay in London for a similar price in better areas. There is nothing in this area worth staying near. Being near to St Pancras international is no reason to stay here as you can get to it easy enough on the tube or by taxi. You would be better going to the Oxford YHA if you are on a budget. The Oxford YHA is modern, new, spotless and in a great location. Piccadilly Backpackers is another cheap option...not the greatest place to stay but it is honestly better than the County "Hotel".

Reviews.Title: “stay at the county”
Reviews.Author: billstorey
Reviews.Content: have said this before excellent location for all the transpo0rt sevices good choice at breakfast and a decent meal in the evening if required.value for money at £59 for a twin room. not en-suite so you know that before you book.bathroom and toilet only a couple of doors away.if you want luxury go and pay silly money elsewhere but the county is superb value for money always stay here when visiting london which is about every 2 months.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly okay and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: acjkt
Reviews.Content: I came across a bargain five nights for the price of four on an internet booking website and thought for the price including Full Cooked breakfast I would give it a shot. I would say that if you are not well travelled or don't mind sharing a bathroom then this place is probably not for you. The hotel is five minutes walk from Euston station, is covered in scaffolding at the moment so it is easy to walk past it, once you get in it's fine. Check in was super fast, you collect your key from the Hall Porter (and deposit it when you go out) and there is a lift to all floors. On exiting the lift, I immediately was reminded of my former Unviersity Halls of Residence, almost a carbon copy in fact. The single room I had was pretty much like the pictures already taken by others, not overly big but big and warm enough. There is a sink and a TV. At first I thought the TV was broken as I couldn't turn it on, although after around five minutes I figured it out, it is hard wired to a light switch by the bed so you have to switch it on there first - rather funny actually but it goes with the quirkiness of the place. The room was spottlessly clean, the bedding was changed every second day. The bathrooms and WC were literally next door and were kept clean, even at night when I returned late they seemed as though they had been given a once over. I didn't experience much of an issue with banging doors, it happened occasionally but I think it's just because people to forgot to close them quietly. As for the comments about cleaners in your room, I can't understand how or why that would happen as you can lock your room easily from inside and they have Do Not Disturb notices so the previous writer must have been a little absent minded not to use either. There is a bar next to reception and the prices are so cheap. £2.20 for a pint of Lager in Central London is almost too good too be true, but it is. I tried their food and again, it was excellent and cheap. Almost student prices. There seemed to be a lot of workers using the bar and eating so this seems to be their mainstay custom. Breakfast was served in the basement, again remeniscent of my University days, the staff whilst monosylabic were attentive. there was a wide selection of cooked and continental stuff and all included in the cheap rate. I certainly would have no hesitation staying here again and as I said if you can live with shared bathrooms then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Value 2 the max!!!!”
Reviews.Author: milesnewton85
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights in this hotel, the highest accolade i can give it, is that id stay again! Me and a couple of mates got 3 single rooms, with breakfast for Â£45. Euston itself isnt exactly the party scene of London, but the hotel is no more than 5 minutes walk from the tube. Everything we wanted to do the whole weekend only took max 15 minutes on the tube max, night clubs (Reflex at Mansion house station unreal!) food and entertainment! The rooms where spotless, the bathrooms/toilet where no more than 5 steps away from our rooms. The staff were unbelievably helpful during our stay, the porters were there 24 hours, so no problems collect our room keys at all hours! If you can, get a rear facing room, you can barely hear the traffic from the main road. If u want a couple of cheap nights in London, go to this place it ticks all the boxes! (Also its only Â£2.20 a pint at the hotel bar, which is by far the cheapest we paid all weekend!)

Reviews.Title: “Don't leave anything behind”
Reviews.Author: Anafalki
Reviews.Content: The rooms and service ok, excellent location, everything in the hotel could be find in the museum. Big problems with housekeeping. They don't understand 'late checking' and U can find a housekeeper in Your room while U still in bed (sic!) And...Don't leave anything behind..U never gona get this back-fact!

Reviews.Title: “Changes but not improvements”
Reviews.Author: RevBillAlaska
Reviews.Content: Let me qualify this by saying I have been using Imperial London's County Hotel in Upper Woburn Place for some 40+ years; most recently in December, 2011. It never was an upscale hotel; basic accommodation, bath down the hall, clean with very pleasant staff. Sometime recently ILH gussied up the lobby with new configuration, paint and trim. Not a good thing. In the original 1930's garb it was quaint and had a certain crude charm. No more. The new decor is pitiful. The staff has changed (the others probably aged out...and I say that with no unkindly intent) and also not for the better. Total confusion over reservations made months in advance. Desk clerk I dealt with at first bordered on surly. Second, hours later (was no longer possible to get a room even a minute before 2pm) was a little more friendly though totally confused. There is free Wi-Fi internet but only in the lobby; does not reach into the rooms. The coin-operated internet computer in the lobby offers worse odds of connection than offers a Las Vegas slot machine in winning. It's still a great value; still a very convenient location but bring lots of patience with you; you'll need it! In fairness, I travel with a group and would still use The County for its low price, decent breakfast and wonderful location (near underground, King's Cross and Euston Stations) but will warn all my friends when planning to be prepared to grin and bear it.

Reviews.Title: “Not the kind of place I would normally stay but......”
Reviews.Author: Shanghai_Traveller1
Reviews.Content: Its clean, itâ€™s cheap, itâ€™s about a 5 min walk from either Euston or Kings X. Now, the staff are irreverent and a bit cheeky â€“ but entirely friendly and competent. The rooms are tiny. You gotta share a toilet with 3 other rooms â€“ and nobody really likes to do that. It's a long way from modern. Butâ€¦..the price is very cheap for London. And the really good bit is that it includes an all you can eat English breakfast. Andâ€¦â€¦for Â£3.50 you can get a really tasty dinner in the bar that is an unparalleled value in all of London. Even if youâ€™re not staying in the hotel, this is great value. Try it. Anyhow if you like a bit of adventure, and donâ€™t mind sharing the loo with a bunch of other folks, this is a very practical hotel to do London for less than one hundred bucks a day. Also a chance to meet some really friendly and interesting travelers â€“ and not a suit to be seen as is normally the case in hotel bars. Not a destination hotel by any means. You really want to spend as little time in the rooms as possible. Not very good for a long term stay either coz the shared toilet gets old in a hurry. But for a few days - it's cool, cheap, and a bit of fun actually. One final word of advice. Never, ever, use a sink in a hotel with a shared toilet to wash your face. Figure it out â€“ just good common sense.

Reviews.Title: “When the going gets wierd, the wierd stay here...”
Reviews.Author: lordweffington
Reviews.Content: Is it still legal to have shared bathrooms? Like going back to 1980's bedsit land, with an assortment of Cuckoo's Nest style residents. Strange place...broken TV, disconnected fridge, vile breakfast, broken disconnected staff. Yet cheap & near where you need to be. Back home now the place feels like a surreal flashback...was I really there, in that place with those people?

Reviews.Title: “Very basic - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: minkypip
Reviews.Content: The location of the County Hotel is ideal for access to central London, and is within a 2 minute walk from Euston Station. The hotel reception were friendly, and changed our twin room to a double upon request. The hotel itself is basic, and the decor faded and old fashioned. The christmas tree in the lobby area had a present which was half wrapped and half box - if you want attention to detail and fancy trimings - go for the Hilton opposite ;-) The room was relatively small, made up of mismatched furntiture and an old portable TV. The bed linen was clean, however the mattress was well worn and we rolled in the middle. The towel on the towel rail had a big stain on it, which had obviously not washed out. The communal toilet (i didn't use the shower) was dirty (stained and had a wet loo roll left on side) but this was in the early hours of the morning. The kettle in the bedroom had a dreg of water left in and some scale. The breakfast was ok, however, we were given a toast size plate for the full english selection. All in all, I would not choose to stay in the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Hotel - A Hostel”
Reviews.Author: TheWestCountryNomad
Reviews.Content: This place is a complete dump which I booked on the mistaken assumption that it might be similar to a premier inn. How wrong I was. It is like something out of the 1940s. It does not have en suite - communal toilets and bathrooms - minging. I have emailed the company to ask for a refund and they have not even replied - what a surprise. It should not be advertising as a hotel when clearly it is a hostel. I checked out immediately and managed to get a room in the Ambassador next door.

Reviews.Title: “Showing its age but not too bad.. for London”
Reviews.Author: Fiver75
Reviews.Content: The County Hotel is an old building. While it is showing its age, the place is okay â€“ there was fresh paint in my room and there was painting and renovating going on during my stay, so at least they are making an effort. While it is old, it is a faded old rather than a dirty old, if you know what I mean â€“ they obviously try to keep it clean inside the rooms and the common areas. Check in was okay, although they had a computer problem so the 3 staff all turned their attention to that and everyone had to wait â€“ I would have thought it would be more efficient for one person to fix the problem while the others checked in other guests? Anyway, after that, the process was smooth. My room was small and contained the basics â€“ a tiny television, kettle and some cups, and a wash-basin. The toilets and showers were communal. The wardrobe was a decent size for such a small room, but the cupboard above was painted shut, so you wouldnâ€™t want to have too many bags; you might end up sleeping on them! The room was recently painted, but still showed some signs of old age â€“ the desk was chipped and the sealing around the wash-basin was coming away. The bed was a very small single, but comfortable enough, once I got used to it sliding around the room when I got in and out of it. The continental breakfast served in the basement was terrible (possibly some sort of joke) â€“ they actually serve up some decent food, but that is not included in the free continental â€“ I did not enquire how much extra it was. The slop they put on display as the â€œfreeâ€� option is a ruse â€“ you would have to be pretty desperate to try it once, let alone every day. I went down the street and had breakfast in a cafÃ© every day. They have free WIFI in the lobby â€“ I didnâ€™t try it so cannot comment on its quality, other than to say that it is available. One little thing that annoyed me was the concierge desk - they ask you to drop your key off then you leave, but when I returned the concierge was NEVER there! Ask at reception and they tell you to go to the concierge desk - it was like going round in circles. When I return to a hotel I expect ANY staff member to be able to assist me ASAP. Not the case here. Concierge - WAKE UP!!!! The location was very good â€“ not even 5 minutes to Euston Tube Station and a slightly longer walk to San Pancras, and with buses passing out the front of the hotel, so it is well connected. There are plenty of shops within walking distance, a Starbucks two minutes down the road and a nice park to enjoy the same distance. An excellent, simple base from which to explore London.

Reviews.Title: “THE COUNTY HOTEL FIRST CLASS”
Reviews.Author: DOOPYMAN
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in sept 2011 and got a nice room and a full english breakfast the bar was ok and cheap drinks Â£2 90p for lager

Reviews.Title: “not to bad”
Reviews.Author: Debbie C
Reviews.Content: I stayed hear from the 11th to the 13th and not as bad as i thought. The 4th flour was clean but the place had a few staines and some dirty bits. the los locked and were clean, the room was clean but was hard to sleep due to people slamming doors. (Yes you can close them without them slamming) Food was ok eat what I liked.

Reviews.Title: “Not suitable for human habitation”
Reviews.Author: Edforce
Reviews.Content: Awful place. The most disgusting place I have ever seen. Rooms and shared bathroom facilities were filthy. Bed tiny and mattress springs were pushing in to my back all night. Buffet breakfast was inedible. Staff were a joke. Do yourself a favor and stay anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: DistrictNurse9
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for and it certainly shows at the County Hotel. If you really only want somewhere cheap to sleep, this is ideal. The reception area is currently being refurbished so it's a bit cold, damp and draughty at the moment - hopefully that will improve. Reception is where the wi-fi access is available, so it needs to be comfortable! Reception staff are very friendly and helpful 24 hours per day. The rooms are small, tired looking and basic. Bed linen is clean and the heating and hot water are in plentiful supply. Each room has a wash-hand basin, bathrooms and toilets are shared by 4 bedrooms. There are no complimentary toiletries. Tea & Coffee making facilities are provided. There is a small analogue TV but no remote control. The restaurant is in the basement, the full english breakfast (7-10am) is average at best and staff, less than interested in customer service. Left luggage is charged at 50p per item per day.

Reviews.Title: “County good value”
Reviews.Author: Lotti17
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central being about 300m to Euston tube station and a little further to Russell Square. It is an old building with basic accommodation but kept very clean. As we were not going to be there during the day we opted for a room without an ensuite. There were 2 toilets and 2 bathrooms on each floor and we never had to wait and there was always fresh bathmats in each bathroom. Toilets and bathrooms were always very clean. Our room had a double bed, 2 hanging cupboards, a dressing table and a hot/cold wash basin, plus tea/coffee making facilities. The cleaning ladies were thorough and very pleasant. Breakfast was a buffet with a variety of 4 cereals, 2/3 juices, fruit salad, prunes, yoghurt plus hot dishes of sausages, bacon, baked beans, scrambled eggs and toast in a warming cabinet. There is wifi, but it can only be used in the reception area. The only negative is that it is noisy with London traffic but that is exactly what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Machino85
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the County hotel for two nights mainly because we could not find any other hotel or hostel with a vacancy. The location is good, accommodation is cheap and you do get a buffet breakfast included which is reasonably good. However, that's about the only positive things I can say. We arrived earlier than check-in on the first day and asked to leave our bags in storage. The porter hardly acknowledged us and pointed to the ground with a grunt to indicate where we were to leave our bags. He gave us a ticket for 2 bags and when we asked if we could leave our two backpacks as well he gave us a strange look, completely ignored our question and just walked back behind the desk. So rude! Unfortunately the rest of the desk staff were not any more helpful. Even though we requested 2 nights, they only booked us in for one night and then questioned why we hadn't checked out the following day. In general the desk staff came across as completely miserable people with no enthusiasm for their job or customer service. Our room was basic, TV didn't work at all and mattresses lumpy. There are lots of other hotels in the near vicinity to this one and if they have availability I would stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: “Geat location. Bargain.”
Reviews.Author: timttrotter
Reviews.Content: aI paid Â£29.50 for onev nights B&B. This was a fantastic price for such a good location. The room was very clean and had tea/coffee making facility, cable tv and a washbasin. The toilet and bath/shower were shared but were clean and well maintained. Breakfast was very nice but the room is small and you may have to wait for a table. There is a bar off the reception area which also serves food. Free wifi is available in the reception area. Highly recommended if you are on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “No frills dated hotel but does the job!!”
Reviews.Author: Southants1976
Reviews.Content: Me and a mate stayed here in May for the FA Cup semi final, it's a nice cheap little hotel, very old, a bit scruffy, and a surprisingly small bunk bed room with sink and a shared bathroom but for what we needed it was great..clean sheets and a good night sleep. Heard someone wretching out of there window at 3am..but it was a saturday night..and it didn't keep me up for more than 2 minutes. Staff seemed fine, however we were told we couldn't check in for an hour after arriving at half elevenish..it was annoying as we were eager to dump our bags and head off to Wembley Stadium, but understand that our room probably wasn't ready.didn't stay for breakfast as we were up late to catch our train. I recommend only if you just want somewhere to hit the sack, you definatley wouldnt want to spend a city break in this hotel, or take your mrs here for a romantic one.

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers”
Reviews.Author: Gordon L
Reviews.Content: For people who wish to book the County Hotel near Euston Train Station in London forget it. The outside of the hotel looks like a bomb as hit it, The windows are not double glazed and there is no bathrooms in the rooms. Warning DO NOT ENTER

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & recommended if you don't mind some bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: kuroshino
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for a weekend for about 59 GBP for a double room with shared bath and shower. The location was fantastic and very handy to anywhere in Central London. Euston and Russell Square station are just near the corner. For this prime location and being on a weekend, I would say the price we paid was fair enough. The breakfast was actually not bad. The bath and shower were cleaned to an acceptable standard. However, the room let us down a bit. The tea making facility was very poor and the cups, plates and kettle were filthy. Plus there were no spoons for tea making. The room was tidy at a first glance. But we got bed bugs in bed. All in all, generally recommended for those looking for a reasonable priced hotel with good location.

Reviews.Title: “This chain of hotels are very poorly managed”
Reviews.Author: AlanLucas
Reviews.Content: I have stayed recently at the County Hotel and Imperial Hotel both owned by the same firm. At one I had left some valuables at reception which were not there when I went to collect them. No one was available to speak to me at the hotel or at the Head Office and I resorted to phoning the police who came down to the hotel and still no one would speak to the police. On another occassion the tinned fruit being served was rancid. I called one of the waiters who took no notice and just walked away - I asked to speak to the restaurant manager and again I was told that no one was available to help me

Reviews.Title: “ive practically lived here for months”
Reviews.Author: grahamjosh
Reviews.Content: i used this hotel whenever i had work in london. i must have stayed here for about a year on and off in about 6 years. stayed for 3 months consecutively. its a budget hotel, make no bones about it. foods cheap, booze is cheap. good location, 3 min walk from euston and 10mins from kings cross. as a builder i know for a fact, that on a mon-fri this is a workers hotel, and the sinks that are located in the bedrooms are used as toilets. tip....if you need a twin room, when checking in, state that you do NOT want a L-shaped room, as one of you will not be able to see the TV

Reviews.Title: “Poor sleep conditions!”
Reviews.Author: Latin_music_lover
Reviews.Content: The rooms are good value if you don't mind very noisy traffic (I was on the 7th floor and could still hear the traffic through the non-double glazed windows at the front of the hotel, they said the back was better. I don't know because I did not stay a second night. Breakfast was fine and service was good. Rooms were small and from a 1970's movie, it was October and central heating had still not been switched on! Rooms were not on-suite, shared bathrooms and toilets all round. If you want budget and don't mind the above then all good if you want something quite a bit better then head down the road to the Bedford, just under twice the price but worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: VinceDurham
Reviews.Content: The County Hotel is central to buses and tube to get you anywhere in London the hotel is in need of refurbishment which was being done when I arrived. The room was clean but very basic. Shared bathroom and toilet but washbasins in the room which was not too much of a problem for us anybody fussy should not stay here. The breakfasts where good you heled yourself with a choice of starter and friut juice then on to the main breakfast of whatever you wanted cooked followed by toast an marmalade or jam. This more than made up for any inconvenance of shared bathroom facilities. Noise could be a problem but I didn't find it too problematic for central location in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: TudorRose80
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a couple of times earlier this year and thought I'd post a couple of bits. 1). The room was adequate for my needs. It was clean, and I slept well. I didn't mind the fact that I had to share toilet and bathroom facilities. 2). The staff were pleasant enough. 3). The breakfasts were adequate. 4). The location was great - not only to the train and underground, but the British Library was within walking distance too. Plus there's a decent laundrette round the corner if you need it. Wouldn't hesitate to stay there again if I was in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: arms0001
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in November 2010. It has to be the most dirty hotel I know, stuck in a time warp from the 70's, very few sockets in the room I actually only counted two. The bed was uncomfortable, the sheets dirty. Reception was unhelpful and rude. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but clean.”
Reviews.Author: IneffableAppetite
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basic, there is a wash stand in your room but toilets and showers are shared. These are clean however, and are fine if you don't mind sharing. The bed was comfy and the breakfast good. The room's decor is a little grim, but the tv did work (albeit without a remote). I would stay here again, it's fine for a quick one night stay in central london if you just need somewhere to sleep. It's certainly better than the Thistle Euston down the road, which is a total rip off and I had a worse night's sleep there.

Reviews.Title: “LONDON SUPERBREAK”
Reviews.Author: billstorey
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel several times. good value for money in a superb location.It is basic with no en-suite but usually a toilet and shower room within a couple of doors away.plenty of choice at breakfast reasonable quality.We only pay about Â£75 pound each for a twin room for 2 nights with train from lancashire which we feel is great value for money.Five minute walk to Euston, not much further to St. Pancas,Kings Cross.Never had a problem with staff and have always left our luggage on the last day which we pick up prior to leaving for our train home.We had the evening meal last time we stayed which was excellant value for money at Â£3.50p. Are staying again for 2 nights early October.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Patrick W
Reviews.Content: Don't understand all the negative reviews. Stayed here many times and while it's basic and the staff quite obviously haven't been on a PR course, if all you want is a bed for the night and a decent breakfast in a handy location Â£45 a night is very reasonable for central London. One or two nights is enough though!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the worst hotel I've stayed in in England”
Reviews.Author: Charlie H
Reviews.Content: My uni accomodation ran out a day before I was able to finish my dissertation; when I saw I could get a room here for only Â£40 for the night I thought I might as well book it rather than having to leave London only to come back the next day. Unfortunately this was a case of getting what you pay for. The hotel wasn't terrible; it did what I needed it do - ie, give me somewhere quietish to sleep and finish writing my dissertation. However, it was probably the worst I've stayed in in England. Pros - cheap price, breakfast included (but pretty low quality), the staff were ok. Cons - generally archaic feel to the hotel; wi-fi was only available in the lobby and that barely worked. The room was tiny and really grotty, and I felt like I had been transported back in time 15 years when I walked in. There was a tiny cathode ray TV that didn't work, a bed, a sink and that was about it! The showers/bathroom was communal, but I didn't dare go in as they looked pretty disgusting. In general the place was pretty grimy. I would only recommend it if you are limited to Â£45, in need of a place to stay, and are for some reason incapable of moving around to find somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Nice London Break”
Reviews.Author: danny21
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 8 nights as my sister was having a operation in London and had to book last minute and was worried about the hotel because of all the bad reviews that it was recieving. Hotel was ok we were in 703 which was a very basic room but was very clean and comfy with tv,tea facilities sink basin. We are coming to London next year for 8 days and would deffo stay here again but hoping to stay somewhere a bit posher next time. Woul deffo recomend this hotel if your on a budget and you just want a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “never again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 963stephdurham
Reviews.Content: the only good thing about this hotel was the location, apart from that it was like been in that hotel out the film the shining with jack nicholson, way out of date, the staff need to go on a people management course,and the porter made my blood boil with his attitude a very rude, ill mannered individual will never return to this establishment

Reviews.Title: “Small but great location”
Reviews.Author: YOICO
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small, staff not very friendly. Regardless the location is just great, across from Euston. Breakfast is fine if you go for English breakfast. Continental is just okay. There is a bus stop just outside the hotel. Rooms not very new but consider the tariff, it is okay.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly with disgusting service”
Reviews.Author: cherbies
Reviews.Content: I had low expectations which is why I didn't rate this as a 1 out of 5. My expectations weren't met. I am all for travelling on a budget, but I expect a certain level of courtesy from the staff. I felt like I was the worst thing that happened to them that day simply by being in their lobby. The whole hotel had a horrible smell which bothered me. The rooms were OK for what we paid. I had expected a double room as requested, however we have slept in single beds before so not the end of the world. We were in an L-shaped room thoguh and had a wall between us when asleep. Just felt strange. The beds were comfortable enough and seemed clean, however the hotel just had a dirty feel about it which made me uncomfortable. I need to mention again that the 4 or 5 staff that we dealt with were all rude and disinterested. Definately no tips from us. English breakfast was included, but nothing was explained to us and we had to ask stupid questions to find anything out. The breakfast itself was not very nice (apart from the bacon). There were 3 waitstaff standing around as we walked in. They all ignored us. We had to go up to them to ask where we could sit, and were waived away and told "anywhere". We only asked as all the free tables were piled with dirty dishes. We were eventually led to a table, but had to move the plates off it ourselve. The table cloth had something spilled across it and we weren't given enough settings for two. We made do and left after eating what we could. On check out we asked if we could leave our bags in storage for the day. This is the first time I have been charged to leave my luggage. Per bag as well! I think for the money paid there were better options in London. The location was good, but I saw a Travellodge down the road that looked much better value. I would not recommend this hotel and wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!.... HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: DomesticGoddess56
Reviews.Content: are these people stuck in the early 70's with this place? no bathrooms in the rooms?... this place is DIRTY !!!!... stay well clear.

Reviews.Title: “Average for how cheap it is.”
Reviews.Author: Seansabazios
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in order to attend a concert at the o2 on a tight budget. Took about 30 minutes to get there during the day but longer on return after concert on the night buses. 4 minute walk from Kings Cross Railway and St. Pancras. Rooms are very small but this was expected, fairly clean but nothing amazing. Staff are friendly enough but wont go out of their way to help as much as other hotels would. would only recommend if you are on a very tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: voyager8472
Reviews.Content: This place was disgusting, the staff were rude, the bedding was dirty, the room was horrible. I will not be booking with this hotel again. The price is good, however there are better hotels in the same price bracket in the general area.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad all things considered”
Reviews.Author: BobSt_Helens_Lancs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Champions League Final in May. We all had a single rooms which cost Â£30 a night. Room was a bit dated but was very clean. It had a TV, a sink and a built in wardrobe. The breakfast was one of the best I have had, buffet style with good quality food including full english or continental. Major downside to the hotel was having to trek across the landing to shower and use the toilet. I would use the hotel again for another lads football trip but may look elsewere if I was taking my wife, mainly due to the 'washroom facilities' set up.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: Freckleton
Reviews.Content: What can I say for the money it is not too bad, A friend and I was due to share a twin room at Â£59, the receptionist asked if we wanted single rooms for the same price, so we was more than happy less than Â£30 a room including a full English. in this life you get what you pay for, if you go with High expectations then you will be disapointed but if you book this with the mind set of the price you paid, then you should have a good nights sleep. The room I had was clean, and so wad the sheets.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE ITS HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: halfamazin
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel on the 13th of may for 1 night dont stay here dirty sheets staff preferred to talk on there mobiles then serve customers and were very rude and impolite unhelpfull the corridoor was filthy as was the bathrooms london is a great place but dont stay here if u go i will post pics up shortly as proof and i will be demanding a refund

Reviews.Title: “dumps in london”
Reviews.Author: goff22
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a glorified b&b, but even then one would expect some standards. the staff were surly and unfriendly,the bathrooms and toilets filthy(have they never heard of bleach ), there was linen and towels in the corridor day and night, the rooms had been given a quick makeover in that the beds were made and coffee /tea replaced but that was it,the only socket in the room was for the kettle,strip lighting in the bedrooms,which were not conducive to any feeling of ambience. i am a night manager in a hotel and my wife the senior housekeeper in the same hotel. if we were to offer our guests what we experienced then i know we would have no guests at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: hugeabbafan
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I did know this hotel did not have en-suites, however, what did I expect for Â£28.50 per night incl breakfast with Superbreak Holidays?. I always pull back the bed sheets when I arrive at any hotel - these were clean. TV you had to switch on an odd way - yes, I understand you would not get a remote control with this hotel, however, you had to switch the TV on by the bed which the porter wasnt aware off and then switch the channels on at the TV. Dont think I am suited without en-suites, just incase you need the toilet in middle of the night and I am not prepared to get dressed again just to use toilet!. Breakfast was fine - good choice, cold or hot. The hotel is in need of updating, new lick of paint etc. If you are on a budget, then yes I would stay here again, however, I would much prefer to stay in a Travelodge next time where I can have a bath and feel comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “STAY WELL CLEAR OF THIS DUMP OF A HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: manibainz
Reviews.Content: Booked via Travel Republic, the hotel looked OK from the pictures but when I arrived to check in I was so shocked at how grubby the hotel looked and how run down it was and it smelled awful! I waited around 20 mins to check in, as there was abit of a queue, and collected Room Key from porter, room was on 7th floor- lift was available. Room itself was dirty, dirty stained bed clothing and dirty cutlry, the shared toilet had a big log [YUK!] that wouldnt flush, bathroom was dirty. When got back to sleep, there was alot of noise outside in hotel corridor and sink kept making alot of nosie too. "BREAKFAST" was on a plate about the same size of a saucer that you use for cups, toast was cold, as was baked beans. When I was getting ready to check out I was changing I had a housekeeping maid walk in on me twice- WIHTOUT EVEN KNOCKING! Ten mins later somebody else walked in on me to "check I was vacating the room" even though it was 9.30am and check out time is 11.00am. Thank God I only booked one night, worst hotel I have ever stayed at NEVER AGAIN! I would rather pay the expensive rates as at least I will be getting a QUALITY HOTEL! AVOID AT ALL COSTS PEOPLE! ONLY ADVANTAGE BEING, THIS "HOTEL" is close to Euston station!

Reviews.Title: “stepping back in time”
Reviews.Author: TIMELORDLeicester
Reviews.Content: very basic rooms like prison cell it was clean toilets showers next door the worst bit was breakfast very unhelpfull staff christmas napkins on tables clenniness neede improving ive usdsd sister hotel tavistock and bedford which are fine this was the pits

Reviews.Title: “adequate budget hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: lemacaron
Reviews.Content: I was dreading the stay at this hotel as part of a school trip after reading so many negative reviews. I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is dated and basic, but clean. Most of the staff weren't very friendly, but there was a nice night porter. My room had a view of Upper Woburn Place and the bed was actually alright. There was some traffic noise. I washed my hair in the sink the next day, because the idea of using a communal bathroom wasn't very appealing. The room keys are on these weird metal bars and they're awkward to use, which is a bit annoying. There's also no sink in the toilet, so one has to touch the door handle and walk across the corridor before being able to use soap and water. Bring shampoo etc because only a small bar of soap is provided. There is Wi-fi in the lobby, but not in the bedrooms. I'm not sure where all the fuss about the hotel is coming from because it's perfectly adequate, well located, and good value. The breakfast wasn't fantastic but I've had worse elsewhere. There were prunes, a selection of cereals, an English breakfast, toast, and fruit juices. If you want to live in your hotel or you're staying for a week or so, it might be best to avoid the County, but it's fine if you're going out and about.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, budget accommodation- only downside no ensuites”
Reviews.Author: dottytee
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe some of the negative reviews on here. I was dreading actually staying at this hotel, but it was absolutely fine. It was clean, somewhat shabby but perfectly acceptable if you are on a budget. The room was comfortable, warm and quiet being sitauted at the rear of the hotel. I would have preferred an ensuite but knew about the shared facilities beforehand. One downside of this being that you couldn't shut the toilet windows and they were freezing. The showers were hot and powerful. Breakfast was OK and set you up for a day of sightseeing. Reception staff extremely unfriendly but porters very helpful. Overall we were happy with this hotel, but would book one with an ensuite another time.

Reviews.Title: “An experience I don't want to repeat!”
Reviews.Author: freerthanyou
Reviews.Content: The surly staff and basic facilities may be explained by price - you get what you pay for at the end of the day. Add to this the smell of urine in the corridor, wires hanging out of sockets in our room and the stained tablecloth at breakfast. Oh well, we thought we could grin and bear it for one night - it's just somewhere to sleep after all! However, this hotel does not even fulfill the basic need of a place to sleep for the night! We barely managed to sleep, not just due to the noise from other guests during the night but also due to the cleaners slamming doors and shouting to each other from 7am onwards. The walls are so thin our room shook every time a nearby door was slammed. We will not be returning, next time we'll pay a little extra to stay in the nearby travelodge instead!

Reviews.Title: “Not for the faint-hearted”
Reviews.Author: Kayleighthorpe
Reviews.Content: When I stopped at the County Hotel it was only for one night, while me and my friend watched a concert we had booked in London. The hotel was so shocking that when we stopped over in the end we ended up having to laugh about it because of just how tragic the situation was! When we initially arrived we entered the reception to a pretty average looknig little hotel, there was nothing major to complain about really. The first real shock came when we was given our room key. The room key was attached to a large metal bar, and had to be handed it between leaving and coming back to the hotel. We shrugged this off because we just assumed that we had gotten what we paid for and the value hotel was hardly going to be anything amazing. Then we entered our room. The room was grimy, and had two single beds of questionable cleanliness. There was a random sink in the corner of our room, we did not know why at first. The main complaint was that our wardrobe had holes in the front of it; and that the holes had been 'filled in' with toilet tissue! As my friend pulled out a piece of tissue we asked ourselved 'What is this place?!' To top it off, the sill on the outside of our window had dirty socks on it, and there was rubbish obviously thrown out of our window and into the ditch below our room. If it was not for our good sense of humour we would have probably kicked up a fuss about the unsanitary and strange conditions we were sleeping in. As previously mentioned we had a sink in our room. There was no complimentary condiments so we had no idea why we needed water running in our room. There was shared bathroom area with toilets and a few rooms with bathubs (which had no locks I might add!) It turns out there was no sinks in our toilet or bath rooms. So it was a case of doing your stuff, then walking back into your room and washing your hands. The door handles in this hotel must be full of germs! To make our stay even more pleasant, a kind individual had left us 'a treat' in one of our toilets which was not cleaned up for the two days we spent in the hotel. We ended up making a video blog of us touring through the hotel and laughing at our misfortune, so we ended up decing the hotel was worth stopping at for the comic value of everything that is wrong with it. The one positive note I can make about the hotel was the included breakfast, which was a lovely buffet style english Breakfast. This made me feel so much better in the morning after having to try and wash my hair in an open bathroom with no shampoo or conditioner. All in all I would have to say that if I am stopping in London again with a tight budget, I would not think twice before paying the extra 20 pound or so to stop at The Premier Inn down the road. Do ont stop at this hotel unless you believe you can handle it! Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine! Cheap and cosy stay. What do you expect for the price?”
Reviews.Author: Harrison2604
Reviews.Content: Seriously, I don't know why so many people are giving this hotel negative feedback! We paid Â£57 for 3 people in a room for 1 night including a tasty full english breakfast in the morning!! Thats Â£19 each, and it's a 5 minute walk from 5 Euston station and a short trip away from the shops! I mean, it's not luxury.. what do you expect for that price? If you're looking at going down to London for a few nights for a meeting, party or whatever then this place is more than ideal. On the way down we were worried that this place was going to be like a Mongolian slaughter house due to all the negative feedback! But seriously, take my word for it... it's fine. Good value for money, nice staff, good breakfast, clean room and a good nights sleep! Harrison - Northamptonshire. Harrison2604@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Never again. Disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: KimShepherd
Reviews.Content: A man sleeping in the corridor. Peoples dirty plates on the floor in the hallway. Abhorrent shared bathroom facilities. A broken window in my room. Dirty bed. Cheap and nasty. It really proves you get what you pay for and I will never again pay to stay there. Awful- just awful.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but good”
Reviews.Author: darkwytche
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the hotel for the long weekend that we were in London. As he had never been to London before we wanted somewhere centralised and it was another member of my family who chose the hotel. in total there were 6 of us - 3 couples. The welcome was weak by the staff at the reception desk however the porter service was excellent, the young man we spoke to was always cheerful, was actually English - somewhat of a rarity. He helped us sort our laptop in the lobby, to get the best routes of the underground and was in brief a true and charming professional. My partner is French and was surprised by the communal bathrooms, this didn't stop him from taking a bath for almost an hour! The water pressure was amazing in the showers, washing away the stress of travel etc. The bathrooms like the bedrooms were old, but very clean. Our room was a double, the bedding clean as were the towels and the room in general. breakfast was typical English fare but as my partner said you get what you pay for and it starts off the day. A good choice of hot English breakfast or cereals and some dried fruits. If you ask nicely they will get you some fresh toast! All in all for location, cleaniliness and service I would reccommend this hotel. Indeed I intend to stay there again early in the New Year!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: vb72
Reviews.Content: This is probably the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. It's only redeeming feature is it's location. I travelled with my partner and we were basically looking for a room to sleep in, somewhere to shower and a breakfast. Reception staff were not friendly and very moody. The shared bathroom facilities were absolutely disgusting. The shower curtain had a layer of slime on it. The top of the walls and the ceiling over the bath were black with mould. The floor was soaked and there were dirty towels from other guests left on the floor. The breakfast was poor, we passed on this on the second morning. The dining area was overcrowded and filthy. The radiator and window frame beside where we were sitting were black with dirt. The room was ok, a bit old but sufficient for the price. The towels left in our room were not clean, one had a handprint of dirt on it. Walls were paper thin. No complaints with the heating. Overall I would not recommend this hotel. It is well located but the price is no excuse for the level of filth encountered.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay”
Reviews.Author: manteca_colora
Reviews.Content: I started looking for a hotel only the week previous to my journey, and in spite of the little advance I still managed to find a single room for four nights at County Hotel. The hotel is quite big and old. It looks dated in general. My room was shabby, but reasonably clean and large (compared to the tiny rooms typical of central London). Shared toilets and bathrooms, but they where clean. The water pressure and temperature is great. Staff at reception is not very nice, neither it was the staff in the dining rooms - they made me feel uncomfortable during every breakfast. Some more negative aspects: - The breakfast buffet was mediocre. No fruit or yogurt, not a lot of variety in general. English breakfast tasted quite bad. The way they keep toast warm make them soft like chewing gum. - No wireless internet connection in the rooms (only in the lobby) - Bad noise isolation among rooms. - Old TV in the room - it didn't event work. - Bring your own shower gel and shampooing. Some positive aspects: - Very cheap, good value for money. - Excellent location - Telephone in the room - Large dining room - Elevator - There's a bar on the ground floor, but I didn't try it. No wonder why this hotel wasn't fully booked one week in advance only, but that happened to be pretty handy for me. I consider I was quite lucky to find this place in such short time. It is cheap and convenient if one doesn't have high aesthetic or human-kindness expectations.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing deal for London”
Reviews.Author: intrepidpam
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the County Hotel every time we go to London, for years. With the drop in the British pound, this hotel just keeps becoming a better and better deal. For 54 British pounds you get a clean and comfortable room for two, a fabulous hot breakfast buffet (eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, potatoes, cooked tomotoes, fish, cereal, juice, and fruit) and a great location (near a subway stop and just a couple of blocks from the British Museum). Sure, the rooms are spartan and the bathrooms are down the hall. Not to mention that the doors are on springs and neighbours inevitably bang their door coming and going. But come on....... for 54 British pounds, I can live with a bit of banging and having to walk down a hall for my bathroom. Our room has always been clean and the bathrooms have never been too busy. We have stayed at County Hotel more than 8 times over six years. Also, on our last visit to the County I was charmed to look out the window in the morning (onto the garden below) and to see a fox jump onto a low roof, trot across it, and jump up onto a higher roof, then cross it and disappear from sight. How neat is that?!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel That Time Forgot!”
Reviews.Author: Jonners6
Reviews.Content: Nice and close to Euston and St Pancras this Hotel was ideally situated for a weekend of sightseeing and musical theatre! We only stayed one night and, while the lack of shower facilities in the rooms is annoying, the hotel is really not bad at all. The showers were clean and in good condition. The rooms were clean with fresh bedding and towels. Trust me, I've stayed in much worse! The decor is very dated but to be honest, for the prices in London this place presents real value for money. Who cares about nice wallpaper when you are just sleeping in the room? If you want to go to London just to sit in a hotel room then this place is not for you (and you should get out more), as merely a base to enjoy the capital's delights from, it is fantastic. The breakfast was excellent as well!

Reviews.Title: “cheap and basic”
Reviews.Author: lucia072
Reviews.Content: you get what you pay for,very handy near buses to the center and euston station.porter,s very helpful.Breakfast ok but staff seem very miserable. Doors banging all the way through the night. showers and toilets in the corridor and very basic. It is cheap so you get what you pay for but it should be called a hostil not a hotel.I asked to have a bowel early as i was leaving receptionist looked shocked and said no.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind batteling with the bed clothes....”
Reviews.Author: saladoor
Reviews.Content: After the surely reception at check in, pens were thrown at us to fill in the guest cards we were told to ask the Porter where are rooms were. Two flights up we found our room, tired, dated, the usual cheap London fair, yellow bedding, pink carpet, if you have stayed in these hotels before, you know what your getting right? TV was bolted down to the vanity top, very cheap TV, not sure who they thought were going to rob that! on a plus note it worked perfectly and was tuned in to all five channels, a few radio channels and several foreign ones. Toilets were small (not en-suite, so if you don't like getting dressed to do your business, don't stay here!), toilet paper cheap and thin and the ceilings were covered in cobwebs, in dire need of a good clean. The showers, though a bath combi thing worked well, not too hot, not too cold, my only issue here was that other visitors had showered and just left there towels etc. on the floor. Sleep was on and off through the evening as me and my partner tugged and pulled at the bedding, thin sheets and some staining from previous guests! Breakfast was ample, lots to choose from, though the prowling staff did make you feel as though you were in a prison, and got you to wondering why they hadn't just handed out plastic knives on arrival, just incase you took fancy to attacking somebody...All in all, a moderately mediocre affair. I've stayed in worse, I've certainly stayed in better. Ideal if you just need a cheap bed for visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “Prepared for the worst and were positively surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Maria_23
Reviews.Content: I paid 38Â£ pr. night for a singleroom (visitlondonoffers.com) with english breakfast. The breakfast buffet consisted of buns and toast, jams, apple and orange juice, cerials, sausages, scrambled and fried eggs, beans and back bacon. A hearty breakfast for a day on the town. The rooms was small but adequate, with old and worn furnishings. However, I got the feeling that the room was very clean. The cleaning lady came by every day with fresh towels. The walls were a bit thin and one could easily hear neighbours doors slamming in the night. I could have used a wifi connection, but then again - with the price I paid I cant ask for much more than I got. The staff was friendly, but I didnt use them much so I cant say much more. Left my luggage on the final day for 0.50Â£ per bag. Would definetly stay here again if travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ann1106
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It really is value for money at Â£57 for a double room, including breakfast which was first class and you could eat as much as you liked. The room was quite basic but was all we needed for our stay. It was clean and tidy and the bathrooms were clean too with bath or shower. Staff were friendly and helpful and allowed us to check in a bit earlier and also let us leave our bags the day we were leaving for 50p a bag until it was time for our flight. I don't know why some people are leaving bad reviews, we have no complaints at all and will definitely be back there next time in London.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers eat your heart out!”
Reviews.Author: prestonnefc
Reviews.Content: I must admit after reading the reviews on this site it was not as bad as I thought. The reception area was very dirty but the receptionist was helpful and polite. Our room was extremely basic and although it appeared clean anything over chest height was thick with dust. We used the room only as somewhere to sleep after a long day of sightseeing and for that it was adequate but do not expect any frills because there aren't any! It was also very noisy as emergency sirens rang out all night on the busy Euston Road. Breakfast was just about ok but the staff were very rude and just wanted you in and out as quickly as possible. I did use the hotel bar and was pleasantly surprised at the beer prices which were about Â£2.40 for bottled beers (I was fleeced in Covent Garden for Â£5.00 a pint!) All in all you get what you pay for and for Central London the price was unbelievable. This place would be ideally suited for young people who want to party all night and crash out drunk in a room without any care for their surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Still incredible value for money.”
Reviews.Author: RevBillAlaska
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The County with my 40-year old son who had never seen the place. He was at first dubious; it's not fancy. The spartan room was actually to his taste. Even moreso, the inexpensive and enjoyable lunch in the bar. The next morning, impressed with the Full English Breakfast - ate his fill and enough for about three others who might have been starving for a month. His only criticism was the breakfast coffee but, then, he's used to Peet's cappucino. At the end of the 2-week trip he remarked that the beds at The County were the best he'd encountered. If you don't care to pay for fancy and want convenience (near Euston, Kings Cross, St. Pancras as well as underground), this is the place. I rate The County excellent on account of the iancredible value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful!”
Reviews.Author: muzzSurrey
Reviews.Content: Don't waste Â£57.00 on this dump. You'd probably be better off sleeping in a cardboard box outside in the street! I can hear other reviewers now saying "what do you expect for Â£57.00 a night"? Well, I've stayed in Travelodges for Â£19.00 - Â£29.00 a night with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “a diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: oneeyewil
Reviews.Content: This place is ace aslong as your head isn't up your backside. really cheap (central london!) Â£56 for a double room with a eat as much as u want buffet breakfast (yes full elglish). Â£3.50 for evening meals and lunches.We had home made steak and ale pie , chips, gravy, veg (the menu is allways tasty). The staff ar really cool and helpful. I absolutely love this place and will continue to stay here. I have been using the county for 10 years! don't stay here if your tools. oh yeah and the building is victorian, with really thick walls, deep corridors and an amazing atmosphere. Also you can keep your luggage for 50p! for the whole day which is perfect for when your leaving as a locker in euston will cripple your wallet. respect!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I expected!”
Reviews.Author: Charletron
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews online, I expected the room to be dirty, ridiculously small & just overall a bad stay. When I arrived (half an hour before check in) the receptionist was ridiculous rude & sharp with me, which struck a nerve as I work with the public every single day in my job, a smile isn't that difficult to give to someone! Although she did let me check in half an hour early. The porter wasn't particularly polite, but not rude either. I was pleasantly surprised with the cleanliness of the room, I didn't use the shared shower/bath facilities but from what I could tell, they were pretty clean, the shared toilets were pretty clean as well. The room itself wasn't that small, considering the location & the fact it was a single room, I wasn't unhappy with it. The bed was quite comfy, however the bed sheets were scratchy & not the best in the world. My main issue was the fact that although I had a do not disturb sign on my door, the maid knocked on my door every 20 minutes or so from 8 o'clock onwards. I'd planned on going down for breakfast, but considering I was rudely awoken a lot earlier than I expected, I put my ear phones in & instead of going down for breakfast tried to make up for my lost sleep. All in all, it wasn't as bad an experience as I expected, it was my first time travelling alone, & it hasn't put me off doing it again in the future, which is a good thing in my eyes!

Reviews.Title: “They can look forward to my custom for many moons to come !”
Reviews.Author: Welsh_guy_in_Wales
Reviews.Content: Considering I paid Â£3.50 for the evening meal in the bar, and Â£43 for the room, with breakfast - as much as you could eat - this hotel has to be London's best kept secret. OK the rooms were basic and the toilets and showers were on the other side of the corridor, but hey for Â£43 in central London, who's complaining ? The bed was clean and comfortable, as was the room. The tv picked up the basic channels, the tea and coffee were great. The receptionist was friendly and efficient, as were the porters. Breakfast was great !

Reviews.Title: “glad i went when i did, so i can never end up there again!”
Reviews.Author: Terryteztez
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 13th May to see Florence at the Apollo, We wanted somewhere near to Euston and we got the county inn.... well.... I am sure places like that are breaking hotel standards rules. They give you this big massive rod attached to your key which you cant take out of the hotel. Anyway we got to our room and it is a good job me and my friend have a sence of humour. The room was miserable, unclean and very worn out. There was a cupboard in the corner and it had holes in the top of it (for airing stuff? i dont know) and these were filled with tissues, wrappers etc it was disgusting. There was a dirty sock on our window ledge and a manky sink with water marks and the glasses were not clean either. There was 'mess' in one of the bathrooms that wasn't cleaned for the duration of our stay (one day but early check in til check out deadline) even as the cleaners were doing their rounds, they just seemed to have put the seat down. They came into our room as we slept and didn't nock or anything, saw us then went out leaving the door to slam. Not good. for a bit extra cash (like Â£13 - Â£15 you can get the premier inn round the corner which i so wish we did. The windows are really old and as it is on a busy street it is quite noisy. We were only staying one night so we just put it down to experience and tried to see the funny side. The hotel needs a make over desperatley and needs to step into modern society. In all fiarness the beds were comfy and the breakfast was good. But something i wouldn't do again!

Reviews.Title: “not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: redsara100
Reviews.Content: OK this was a cheap B&B and I was expecting the worse but it wasn't so bad. Yes, the foyer does smell like wee-dont know why- but upstairs it was fine. Rooms small with strip light but all you need-TV kettle hangers. Most important IT WAS CLEAN. Shared toilets were victorian but again SPOTLESS as was the bathrooms. It was abit like being on a school holiday in a YHCA- running down the corridors in a bath towel!! All the staff were helpful-we were allowed to put our suitcases in the room at 10am on arrival even though it had said after 3. The night porter was still on duty late at night when we staggered back in in the early hours and had a cheery word for us., and we stored our suitcases the next day, all day whilst we whent out till 6pm for 50pence! It is a 2 minute from euston station so very handy if your comming in on that line and very central to the west end, oxford street etc. The breakfast was extensive with a hot buffet that you could go back to again and again...eat as much as you want. If you dont intent to spend any time in the room except sleeping and want to fill up for the day this place is worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Appalling, but cheap”
Reviews.Author: MrRoss
Reviews.Content: Yes its only GBP 40.00 a night but be prepared to get what you pay for. Which is pretty much nothing! On arrival, there was a drunk girl slurring at reception. Then my room was the tinest thing ever with just a wash basin. It is shared toilets and showers in this place which are not clean believe me. I did not bother washing and checked out two days early and went to the hilton across the road! I had people being sick in the toilets all night long as I gathered most people staying at the hotel are young people on a budget literally needing a place just to pass out after partying all night. Its perfect for that. Clealiness and the fact its about 200 years over due a refurbishment was the worse part for me but if your on a budget and can handle a bit of rough then I suppose its fine.

Reviews.Title: “Only hotel we could find free on NYE”
Reviews.Author: Rossmurphy
Reviews.Content: To be honest the hotel does smell of fish when you walk in and is full off wierdos, but we only paided Â£40 for the night and it was just some where to put are heads down for 3 hours after partying on nye... The rooms are very basic, cleaners kept trying to get in our room every 30 min which was annoying! Wouldn't recommend to familys, only to people who don't mind very basic stuff... Good location for the tube though... Also they allowed us to check in at 7am! which was nice off them...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: caulfieldScotland
Reviews.Content: We are budget travellers preferring to make the most of our time exploring our destination. This hotel is cheap, clean and in a fantastic location. It was actually a lot better than expected having read the reviews and the only real criticism we had was the quality of the sausages at breakfast! The staff were friendly and the County Bar was comfortable and drinks were good value for money. Don't be put off if you want somewhere to sleep after a long day and night in London - this place is just the job.

Reviews.Title: “cheap, clean and funny”
Reviews.Author: pastilka
Reviews.Content: as a traveller from abroad i must say this hotel has certain qualities of the same kind as london tube, double-deckers and fish and chips wrapped in news papers. first you are a bit shocked how worn-out everything is, but the longer you stay the stronge you go under its charm. very good for its price. we had very small but clean room, clean bed clothes every day. all the facilities were clean. breakfast was very "english" - as it was supposed to be - maybe even too much, all the saussages, bacon, beans.... we would appreciate youghurt. town transport very close, very close to the center. the only thing i found annoying was that you enter your room right from the common corridor, so if unlucky of neighbours the room can be a bit noisy. i would return here if i travelled to london again.

Reviews.Title: “old and smelly..”
Reviews.Author: touroperatorchimera
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have been in London for 3 days and 2 nights and we have been in County hotel.. the hotel is very close to the centre of the city (very near to British Museum) and it's well served by the tube and buses.. and this is the best (and only) quality of this hotel! the hotel is old, smelly and very very fatiscent! the room (we were at 6th floor!!) was small, and there are no service inside the room, just a very little washbasin were you should wash your hands..but it's pretty impossible! the windows are so dirty that you can't look trough! the bed linen was clean, but the pillow was very very dirty and smelly! I could'nt use it!!! the bath was not too bad, it was clean and essential even if there are no washbasin so when you go to the wc you have to come back to the room for wash your hands! foolish! we were lucky because we were the only user of this bathroom! but i won't imagine when there are people of 4 rooms using it! the breakfast is simple, essential and not too bad.. Finally I think I won't come back again..and of course there's something better!

Reviews.Title: “County Hotel - Count us out”
Reviews.Author: FelicityManchester
Reviews.Content: There may be worse hotels in the Greater London area, but you will have great difficulty in finding one. Problems included dirty surroundings, a lift which smelt of urine. harsh lighting, communal bathrooms, poor service from staff. All in all an experience you would want to forget as soon as possible. The best feature of our stay was that it was only for one night. Not an experience we would want to repeat in a hurry. We did not stay for breakfast, after an uninvited visitor to our room, who could not be discerned to be a member of staff or of the public,as when I screamed in horror they beat a fast retreat. We rushed out of the establishment as fast as possible, absolutely horrified.

Reviews.Title: “Its not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: Lindibelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with a friend and I do not think it is as bad as others said! Its a budget hotel! Its old fashioned and in need of a paint job but it was clean and the Buffet breakfast was very good! I saw the chef comein several times and replenish the food. You do have shared bathrooms but the showers were certainly powerful! You get what you pay for and its no frills but if you just want somewhere central to put your head down then you could do a lot worse! The porters were rather abrubt though and it is in a time warp. Also, ask for a room at the back as the traffic can be a bit noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place at all cost!”
Reviews.Author: erikasarah
Reviews.Content: The County Hotel in London is the most miserable place I've ever seen... Me and my partner are budget travellers and we've been to London loads of times, but no hotel or hostel we've ever stayed at prepared us for this... The reception area is a dark and gloomy hole, with dirty carpet and a low grey broken ceiling. The whole place feels like a prison... Our room was on the third floor, and above the door was a terribly dusty and dirty grid. The room is lit by fluorescent tubes, making for a atmosphere as far away from cosy as you could possibly imagine. There were several locks on the door, increasing the feeling of unsafety. The TV was from the 1980s and everything else in the room was broken. We half expected to find a dead body in the wardrobe. As soon as we entered the room we went down again to cancel the other nights we'd booked at this terrible place. Fortunately this was no problem, in fact the staff hardly seemed surprised when I told them we thought the hotel was terrible. We hardly slept there. At 8:30 a most unfriendly cleaning woman kept knocking with her keys on our door and trying to push it open. Fortunately; we'd locked the door! We didn't bother staying for breakfast but from what I read here we didn't miss out on anything. Don't go to this hotel, if you want cheap accomodation in London, try on of the EasyHotels...Their rooms only cost half as the County's and they're ensuite, clean and modern!

Reviews.Title: “Me and my grandson at the County..wish we'd gone elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Ruth2802
Reviews.Content: I didn't think hotels like this existed anymore!! From the seedy, dirty, paper strewn reception to the even seedier Concierge desk this plac.e is just dreadful. I had a 5 year old with me so couldn't just move around and find somewhere else. It's grotty, miserable, dropping to pieces and depressing. Staff are not interested and in short supply. My room was a disgrace....budget or not, nothing should be this bad. STEER CLEAR...cheap rooms, well, even for cheap this was 100% over charging.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: dolphinboy1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over night for 1 night this week as everything was last minute. Im used to quite fancy places as a rule, so i expected the worst. The price was Â£43 for a single for 1 night including breakfast.(doubles/twins Â£56) The staff at reception were fins and i checked in ok and found my room on the first floor. the room is nothing at all to write about, just a bed a small tv wardrobe, chair and a sink. but it was clean, i checked the bed and that was clean. its not the place you would want to be in your room too long, just a place to crash. the room had strip flourecent lighting, which is very odd. The breakfast was surprisingly ok, a full on english breakfast with all the things you would expect to find. my over all verdict would be, its great for a short time or just to crash out. bear in mind, also, that its quite central london and at the price its a steal. what do people expect for that price?? most hotels start around Â£80 upwards in that area. people need to get real, at this hotel you do get what you pay for, and at that price for a short time, i have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for London”
Reviews.Author: WE177
Reviews.Content: The County Hotel is one of those seedy hotels you are either going to love or hate. Its got a lot of character even though the paint is peeling off the walls and there is a strange smell in the air. I paid about Â£40 per night which is not bad. You don't get much for that. The rooms are cramped, the beds are lumpy and if you want a wash you will have to walk down one of those spooky corridors that looks like something out of The Shining! The showers are actually worth the effort. The County hotel is in a pretty good location. I found it really useful for catching the Eurostar to Brussels (ten minute walk). Its also in a great location to visit the British Museum and there is a Tube Station at Euston, which is just a hop across the road. From there its only a couple of stops to the centre of London.

Reviews.Title: “In need of change”
Reviews.Author: PSNorthWestUK
Reviews.Content: First the positives. The hotel is easy access from Euston station and compared to many hotels in London it comes out relatively cheap. Been racking my brain trying to think of other things but haven't come up with any. The facilites are miserable. The door to my room looked as though it had been kicked in and was flimsy. Felt a bit doubtful about leaving anything in the room. The room itself can best be described as basic. The shared toilets and showers are archaic. There seemed to be a constant stream of laundy packed around the corridors. Breakfast was grotty and the crockery and cutlery had all seen better days and were grubby. I don't think it was the age of the knife that prevented me cutting into the sausages; it was more that they seemed to have a closer connection to leather than meat. The staff gave the impression that they would rather be anywhere else than in the hotel and the attitude to guests was that we were a bit in the way rather than the reasons why they were in work. Overall this place needs to improve both in terms of its customer care and the quality and range of its facilities. Not the worse place I have stopped at but closer to that end of the scale than the other.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it!”
Reviews.Author: Elaine017
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in much cleaner and certainly more pleasant youth hostels for half the price. The place was filthy and the staff were rude and unhelpful. Stay full clear of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, cheap and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: MarjanJerman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very simple and completely tasteless, but it is cheap, clean and conveniently located. Even the shared bathrooms were always available, clean and had hot water. Also, the breakfast were very good.

Reviews.Title: “What a BUDGET "" find""”
Reviews.Author: fivetenmale_9
Reviews.Content: The hotel was built in the 1930's and is in mint condition. All the rooms have shared baths tub /great shower head with hot water that are very clean and convenient to the rooms. For Â£ 43 per nite (( sing)) incl a fab full english buffet brakfast it's a great deal. And I might add that the location from Heathrow via the Picadilly line off at Russell Sq is Soooooo nice. And it's close to EVERYTHING !! Oh yeah and the pub attached has great cheap daily food lunch and dinner but your on your own for Sat and Sun ( they off ) Superb bus connections Euston Station Cambden Mkt,....

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff, Dirty Places, No Sleep!”
Reviews.Author: topicalfire
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a stopover before an early morning coach tour to Europe as it was cheaper than the one the tour company suggested. Location was perfect for what I wanted, and at a price I could afford. I arrived before check-in, and was told by the ?Spanish receptionist to take my bag to the porter and check in later. She didn't even want to see any documents to check I did actually have a reservation (I'm now thinking "Free Left Luggage in London!"). Room was tiny, and so loud! I overlooked the main road which is busy all night, so didn't sleep at all! Plus, there were banging doors all night, presumably because of the bathrooms along the corridor. Bathrooms and corridors were acceptable until I found a dirty plate festering away next to the lifts! Bathroom light didn't work either so had to walk to get to one that did. I would recommend it, only as a stop-over for the tours, it's nearly Â£30 cheaper than one the company recommends and it's only a 5 minute walk from where the tours starts.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: rlm001
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very convenient for those arriving at Kings Cross, St Pancras, or Euston stations, and is very centrally situated in the Bloomsbury area of London, near the British Museum. It is very reasonably priced by London standards, which compensates for its shortcomings (in my view). The main limitation is that WCs and shower/bathrooms are shared, which means that they are not always terribly hygenic, although they are serviced and cleaned every day. The single room I stayed in was clean enough, but very tatty, and, like the whole hotel, badly in need of refurbishing and decorating. The breakfasts provided a reasonable choice of cereals, fried foods, etc. Staff are not particularly helpful or friendly, although I think that is not unusual for London hotels. The porters were particularly surly, and the serving staff in the restaurant not much better. I think that the hotel does offer reasonable value for money, and is OK if you just look on the hotel as a roof over your head while visiting the exciting city of London.

Reviews.Title: “sleeping in a morgue would be better!!”
Reviews.Author: pandy73
